---
title: "Supported models"
keywords: "Supported models, model risk management, ValidMind"
---

As of the current release (v1.9.3), the Developer Framework supports the following model types: 

| Modeling task               | Model technique              |Python framework | Python Class                | Comments      | 
|-----------------------------|------------------------------|-----------------|-----------------------------|---------------|
|Binary Classification        |Extreme Gradient Boosted trees|XGBoost          |XGBoost classifier           |Fully supported|
|Binary Classification        |Logistic Regression           |scikit-learn     |LogisticRegression           |Fully supported|
|Binary Classification        |Random Forests                |scikit-learn     |RandomForest                 |Fully supported|
|Forecasting                  |Linear Regression             |statsmodels      |regression.linear_model.OLS  |Fully supported|
|Forecasting                  |Linear Regression             |statsmodels      |regression.linear_model.GLS  |Fully supported|
|Forecasting                  |Linear Regression             |scikit-learn     |linear_model.LinearRegression|Fully supported|
|Binary Classification        |Logistic Regression           |statsmodels      |statsmodels Logit            |Partial support (PFI, CSI, PSI, and SHAP not yet supported)|
|Binary Classification        |Neural Networks               |PyTorch          |nn.module                    |Partial support (PFI, CSI, PSI, and SHAP not yet supported)|

## Related Topics

* Check out our [Developer Framework documentation](developer-framework-introduction.qmd) for more details on how to use our documentation and testing functions with supported models.
